title: Native SACM
content:
Native SACM is one single solution for the entire Service Asset & Configuration Management (SACM) process with instant access to the data and embedded graphical widgets for CI topology representation.

Instead of a loosely coupled and single-directional data replication, Native SACM is a natively connected solution that enables bi-directional data federation between Service Management and UCMDB, which is achieved by building a new technology called UCMDB Gateway.

After UCMDB Gateway is set up and ready, you can enable Native SACM in the tenant application settings. Please be aware that this operation can't be reverted, once you have enabled Native SACM, you can no longer use OPB to connect Service Management and UCMDB.

Compared with the traditional Service Management-UCMDB integration through OPB, Native SACM brings the following benefits:

  • Up-to-date services and inventory
  • Bi-directional data flow
  • One service model and CI topology
  • End-to-end lifecycle
  • Auditing including federated attributes
  • Enriched CI information
  • Codeless configuration

Scope of Native SACM

Native SACM is implemented for the following Service Management record types:

  • Actual Service
  • Devices
  • Service Component
  • System Element

Note: Infrastructure and peripherals are currently not federated with UCMDB CIs.

Once Native SACM is active, any objects created with one of these 4 record types are joined with an identical record in UCMDB. The Global-ID is used as the key.

This means, whenever a new record is created in either Service Management or UCMDB, the same record will immediately appear on the other side. To test the Native SACM status, you can create a record in Service Management or in UCMDB and see how they are shown in both systems.
